newsitem.title: USA: Arkansas House passes bill on telecom competition.
newsitem.headline: Arkansas House passes bill on telecom competition.

text.p: - The Arkansas House of Representatives gave final legislative approval Thursday to a bill allowing competition for local telephone service.
The bill needs only the signature of Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee to become law.
"The governor wants to take a look at the pro and con of it before making a decision on signing it," said Rex Nelson, Huckabee's press secretary.
The bill passed both houses of the Arkansas legislature by such wide margins -- 32 to one in the state Senate and 92 to three in the House -- that a veto appeared improbable.
